ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: The typical format of a class:One student passes out a handout with questions (and sometimes a brief summary) from the readings. Then, we would go through them and discuss. We followed the one-finger/two-finger protocol, which was particularly useful.As the course went on, I think that our discussions calcified and became more professional (on the students' partââthat is, the tenor changed and became higher-level and more well-informed). That was a really key dynamic that I appreciated throughout the semester. I'd definitely recommend the course to other students for that reason, as well as for the fact that it provided such a great springboard for studying for the comps and for doing further reading.
yes, absolutely - very interesting and well taught

I would recommend this class, but only if a student had plenty of free time (perhaps only two other classes). It is such a huge time commitment, that it is hard to do much else alongside it. But as far as how interesting and fun it was as a class, I would recommend it.
Required for gaining IR foundations, a lot of reading, ideal learning experience if you put the work inAbsolutely would recommend, esp for first semester students
Very thorough and good advanced intro to IR poli sci PhD students. It was of fundamental importance as someone in the field of IR.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course gave me ideas that I hadn't even considered before, and for that, I'm extremely grateful.
No dissertation research just yet, but I feel like I'm learning some IR fundamentals.
This certainly was a great help in preparing for the comprehensive exams and for my dissertation research.
Rounded out my basic knowledge of IRDefinitely laid out opportunities for research in future field gapsProvided clear instructions useful for critiquing research and building research plans
It was an essential course, especially to course out and/or take the comp exam.Also very useful as a survey of the literature.
